intro: Diplocalyx pallidus, commonly known as the pale diplocalyx, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pale pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are borne in clusters and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
